intro: Centaurea myconia, commonly known as the Greek eryngo, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and spiny bracts, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions. Centaurea myconia is also noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
